title: Maritime Romance & Night Market
subTitle: 海派浪漫經典線：色彩、奇岩與夜市巡禮
intro: A classic route connecting the most colorful spots in Keelung. Visit the 'Taiwanese Venice', the strange rocks of Heping Island, and the famous Miaokou Night Market.
transportation: **Taiwan Tourist Shuttle T99 (Coastal Keelung Shuttle Bus)**.

spots.name: Zhengbin Fishing Port (正濱漁港色彩屋)
spots.description: Known as the 'Venice of Taiwan'. The colorful houses reflect beautifully on the water. Don't miss the nearby Agenna Shipyard ruins.

spots.name: Heping Island Geopark (和平島地質公園)
spots.description: Features unique geological formations like the 'Ten Guardian Rocks'. It was also the first place in Northern Taiwan to encounter the West (Spain).

spots.name: Keelung Miaokou Night Market (基隆廟口夜市)
spots.description: One of Taiwan's most famous food hubs. Try the Nutritious Sandwich (Stall 58) and Tempura (Stall 16).

title: West Coast Cave Adventure
subTitle: 西岸秘境探險線：洞穴、砲台與大船入港
intro: Avoid the crowds and explore the historic west bank. Crawl through natural sea caves and visit ancient forts overlooking the harbor.

spots.name: Baimiweng Fort (白米甕砲台)
spots.description: Also known as 'Holland City'. The three large chimneys nearby create a unique industrial landscape against the blue ocean.

spots.name: Fairy Cave & Buddha Hand Cave (仙洞巖 & 佛手洞)
spots.description: A natural sea-eroded cave temple. Explore the maze-like Buddha Hand Cave to find the giant handprint formation on the ceiling.

spots.name: Keelung Shelter (信二防空洞)
spots.description: Experience the air-raid shelter elevator that takes you directly up to Fan-shaped Square for a view of the city.

title: Mountain, Sea & Railway
subTitle: 山海深度與鐵道慢旅：八斗子與市區
intro: Combine the ecology of Badouzi with the bustle of the city. Ride the rail bike and visit the National Museum of Marine Science and Technology.

spots.name: Shen'ao Rail Bike (深澳鐵道自行車)
spots.description: Ride a cute pufferfish bike along the coast. Enjoy the sea breeze and mountain views. Reservation is required.

spots.name: Chaojing Park (潮境公園)
spots.description: Originally a landfill, now a beautiful sea park. Famous for the giant broomstick art installation and great views of Keelung Islet.

spots.name: Keelung Tower (基隆塔)
spots.description: Inspired by harbor cranes. This vertical lift takes you to the hilltop for a panoramic view of the port.

title: Rainy City Vibe & History
subTitle: 雨都情調與文史散策：巷弄與咖啡
intro: Discover the charm of the 'Rainy City'. Wander through old commission stores, visit hidden forts, and enjoy Keelung's strong coffee culture.

spots.name: Commission Store District (委託行街區)
spots.description: Once the hub for imported goods in Taiwan. Now a retro cultural block filled with cafes and vintage shops.

spots.name: Ershawan Fort (二沙灣砲台)
spots.description: Also known as 'Gate of the Sea'. Hidden in the forest, it preserves the complete layout of a Qing Dynasty coastal fort.

spots.name: Loka Cafe (港邊咖啡)
spots.description: Enjoy a cup of coffee while watching large ships enter and leave the harbor. A quintessential Keelung experience.

title: Offshore Island: Keelung Islet
subTitle: 全境制霸：島嶼、燈塔與美食
intro: Known as the 'Dragon Pearl of Taiwan'. A volcanic island offering a challenging hike to the lighthouse and 360-degree ocean views.

spots.name: Keelung Islet Lighthouse (基隆島燈塔)
spots.description: Climb 1,137 steps to reach the summit. The black-and-white octagonal lighthouse is the first in Taiwan to use solar power.

spots.name: Keelung Miaokou Night Market (基隆廟口夜市)
spots.description: After returning to the main island, enjoy the famous night market food.

title: Slow Living in Rainy City
subTitle: 慢活雨都：在地生活與感官體驗
intro: Live like a local. Visit traditional markets, the most beautiful sea-view bookstore, and historical battlefields.

spots.name: Ren'ai Market (仁愛市場)
spots.description: A foodie paradise. The second floor is filled with sushi bars, cafes, and local eateries. Try 'Cherry Sushi' or 'Duo Hao Cafe'.

spots.name: Wangyou Valley (望幽谷)
spots.description: A V-shaped valley trail offering stunning coastal views. The name means 'Forget Worry Valley'.

spots.name: Taiping Bluebird Bookstore (太平青鳥書店)
spots.description: Converted from an abandoned elementary school. Located right next to the 'KEELUNG' sign, offering the best view of the harbor.
